This guide is a simplified overview of '''all non-experimental changes''' in [[Spring to Life]] ({{BE}} 1.21.70), which assumes at least some familiarity with [[The Garden Awakens]] (Bedrock Edition 1.21.50), excluding experimental features in this version.

== Mobs ==
=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Mobs}} 
|-
| [[Pig]], [[cow]] and [[chicken]]
| {{animate|Cold Pig.png;Warm Pig.png|128px}} <br> {{Animate|Cold Cow.png;Warm Cow.png|128px}} <br> {{Animate|Cold Chicken.png;Warm Chicken.png|128px}}
| 
* New mob variants have been added, the variant is determined by the biome they spawn in.
* Temperate variant - The pre-existing mob variant.
** Spawns by default where the cold and warm variants do not spawn.
* Cold variant spawns only in:
** {{BiomeLink|Old Growth Pine Taiga}}
** {{BiomeLink|Old Growth Spruce Taiga}}
** {{BiomeLink|Taiga}}
** {{BiomeLink|Snowy Taiga}}
** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Hills}}
** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Gravelly Hills}}
** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Forest}}
* Warm variant spawns only in:
** {{BiomeLink|Savanna}}
** {{BiomeLink|Savanna Plateau}}
** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Savanna}}
** {{BiomeLink|Jungle}}
** {{BiomeLink|Sparse Jungle}}
** {{BiomeLink|Bamboo Jungle}}
** {{BiomeLink|Eroded Badlands}}
** {{BiomeLink|Wooded Badlands}}
** {{BiomeLink|Badlands}}
* When bred by a [[player]], a baby variant will not be chosen by the current biome, but instead randomly selected from one of the parents' variants.
* Can now spawn on [[Spawn event|Spawn events]] and they used command [[Commands/summon|summon]] or [[Commands/event|event]] to spawn this variants Cold and Warm Animals
|-
| [[Sheep]]
| {{animate|White_Sheep_JE3_BE6.png;Black_Sheep_BE5.png;Gray_Sheep_BE5.png;Light_Gray_Sheep_BE5.png;Brown_Sheep_BE5.png;Pink Sheep BE5.png|128px}}
|
* Changed the rules for sheep coloring to be based on which biome they spawn in:
** Temperate biomes:
*** Common:
**** [[White sheep]]
*** Uncommon:
**** [[Black sheep]]
**** [[Brown sheep]]
**** [[Gray sheep]]
**** [[Light gray sheep]]
*** Rare:
**** [[Pink sheep]]
** Cold biomes:
*** Common:
**** [[Black sheep]]
*** Uncommon:
**** [[Brown sheep]]
**** [[Gray sheep]]
**** [[Light gray sheep]]
**** [[White sheep]]
*** Rare:
**** [[Pink sheep]]
** Warm biomes:
*** Common:
**** [[Brown sheep]]
*** Uncommon:
**** [[Black sheep]]
**** [[Gray sheep]]
**** [[Light gray sheep]]
**** [[White sheep]]
*** Rare:
**** [[Pink sheep]]
* [[Sheep]] colors for temperate biomes is unchanged from current behavior.
|-
| [[Creaking]]
| [[File:Creaking_JE1_BE1.png|128px]]
|
* Can now be named using [[name tag]]s.
** Named creakings will persist through the day.
*** However, it will still be torn down if stuck with a player or if it is too far from its heart.
** Named creakings are still resistant to all damage, and can communicate with their hearts via particles.
|-
| [[Villager]]
| [[File:Plains_Villager_Base_JE2.png|128px]]
| 
* Cartographers now sell seven new maps which each point to a different village or other structures in a different biome. These maps can help players who want to quickly find a specific location.
* Cartographers from different village types will sell a different range of maps and colored banners.
|-
| [[Wandering trader]]
| [[File:Wandering_Trader.png|128px]]
|
* The changes to wandering trader trades have been moved from experimental features and are now available during normal gameplay.
** Wandering traders now have better prices, more trades, and sell larger amounts of many items.
** Wandering traders can now buy basic supplies from players.
** Wandering traders can offer to buy two items from this list:
*** [[Water bottle]]
*** [[Water bucket]]
*** [[Milk bucket]]
*** [[Fermented spider eye]]
*** [[Baked potato]]
*** [[Hay bale]]
** Wandering traders now have a chance of selling these items in addition to their previous trades:
*** [[Log]]s (acacia, birch, dark oak, jungle, oak, spruce, pale oak, or cherry)
*** Enchanted [[iron pickaxe]]
*** [[Potion of Invisibility]]
|-
| [[Camel]]
| [[File:Camel JE1 BE2.png|128px]]
| Can now rarely spawn in [[desert]]s.
|-
| [[Donkey]]
| [[File:Donkey.png|128px]]
| Now spawn in [[savanna]]s.
|-
| [[Wolf]]
| [[File:Wolf_JE2_BE2.png|128px]]
|
* Added six new sound variants.
** The variants are called Classic, Big, Cute, Puglin, Angry, Grumpy, and Sad. The existing wolf sounds are used for the Classic variant.
** Wolves receive a random sound variant when they spawn.
** Sound variants are not related to texture variants.
|}

== Blocks ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Blocks}} 
|-
| [[Leaf litter]] 
| {{Animate|Leaf_Litter_4_(N)_JE1.png;Leaf_Litter_3_(N)_JE1.png;Leaf_Litter_2_(N)_JE1.png;Leaf_Litter_1_(N)_JE1.png|84px}}
| Found on the floor of [[forest]]s, [[dark forest]]s, and [[wooded badlands]].
{{Smelting
  |Any leaves
  |Leaf Litter
  |ingredients=Any [[Leaves]] block
}}
| Any
|
* Can be used as fuel.
* Can be used in a [[composter]].
|-
| [[Wildflowers]]
| {{Animate|Wildflowers 1.png;Wildflowers 2.png;Wildflowers 3.png;Wildflowers.png|84px}}
| Grows in [[birch forest]]s, [[old growth birch forest]]s, and [[meadow]]s.
| Any
| 
* Can be placed in four orientations.
* Can be crafted into yellow dye.
{{Crafting|Wildflowers
|Output = Yellow Dye
|shapeless = 1
|ignoreusage = 1
}}
|-
| [[Firefly bush]]
| [[File:Firefly Bush JE1.png|84px]]
| Generates in swamps and near rivers.
| Any
|
* When it's dark, glowing firefly particles appear around the firefly bush, up to 5 blocks away.
* Can be used in the [[composter]], with a 30% chance to add a layer.
* Using [[bone meal]] on a firefly bush will spread it to nearby blocks.
* Emits a light level of 2.
* Can be instantly broken without any particular tool.
|-
| [[Bush]]
| [[File:Bush JE1.png|84px]]
| 
* Generates in the following biomes:
** {{BiomeLink|Plains}}
** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Hills}}
** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Gravelly Hills}}
** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Forest}}
** {{BiomeLink|River}}
** {{BiomeLink|Frozen River}}
** {{BiomeLink|Forest}}
** {{BiomeLink|Birch Forest}}
** {{BiomeLink|Old Growth Birch Forest}}
| Any
|
* They are tinted by the grass color of the biome they are placed in.
* Can be used in the [[composter]], with a 30% chance to add a layer.
* Using [[bone meal]] on a bush will generate a neighboring bush next to it if possible.
* Can be instantly broken without any particular tool.
|-
| [[Cactus flower]]
| [[File:Cactus Flower JE1.png|84px]]
| Has a chance of generating on cactuses in [[desert]]s and [[badland]]s.
| Any
|
* Can be placed on cactus blocks or any block which has center support at the top of the block.
* Has a chance of growing on cactus blocks.
** If a cactus is one or two blocks high the flower has a 10% chance to grow instead of the cactus getting higher.
** If a cactus is three blocks or higher the flower has a 25% chance to grow.
** Cactus flowers will only grow if they have space on all four sides.
* Can be mined without any tool.
* Can be used in the [[composter]], with a 30% chance to add a layer.
* Can be used to craft 1 [[pink dye]].
|-
| [[Short dry grass|Short]] and [[Tall dry grass|tall]] dry grass
| {{animate|Short Dry Grass.png;Tall Dry Grass.png|84px}}
| Generates in the [[desert]] and [[badlands]].
| Any
|
* Both short and tall variants are one block high.
* Can be placed on types of [[sand]], [[terracotta]] and [[dirt block]]s like the [[dead bush]].
* Can be obtained using [[shears]] or a [[Silk Touch]] tool.
* Can be bone mealed.
** Using [[bone meal]] on short dry grass grows it into a tall dry grass.
* Can be used in the [[composter]], with a 30% chance to add a layer.
* [[Sheep]] can eat short dry grass to regrow its wool.
* Can be used as fuel for smelting, where they smelt half an item.
|}

=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Blocks}}
|-
| [[Lodestone]]
| [[File:Lodestone.png|84px]]
| Crafted with iron instead of netherite.
|-
| [[Leaves]]
| [[File:Sprite AllLeaves.png|84px]]
| Generate falling leaf particles.
|-
| [[Creaking heart]]
| {{animate|Creaking_Heart_JE2_BE2.png;Active_Creaking_Heart_JE1_BE1.png|84px}}
| 
* Correctly placed between Logs have a new dormant texture during the day.
** Dormant creaking hearts cannot spawn new creakings and resin.
* The transition between the awake and dormant states of creaking hearts is now based on the fixed day time.
|-
| [[Eyeblossom]]
| {{animate|Closed Eyeblossom JE1.png;Open_Eyeblossom_JE1_BE1.png|84px}}
| The transition between the states of eyeblossoms is now based on the fixed day time.
|-
| [[Iron bars]], [[iron block]], [[iron trapdoor]],<br>[[iron door]] and [[heavy weighted pressure plate]]
| {{animate|Iron_Bars_(EW).png;Block_of_Iron_JE4_BE3.png;Iron_Trapdoor_JE3_BE2.png;Heavy_Weighted_Pressure_Plate_JE2_BE2.png|84px}}
| Added new break, place, step, fall and hit sounds.
|}

== Items ==
=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Items}}
|-
| [[Bundle]]
| {{Animate|Bundle Filled BE1.png; White Bundle.png;Light Gray Bundle.png; Gray Bundle.png;Black Bundle.png; Brown Bundle.png;Red Bundle.png;Orange Bundle.png;Yellow Bundle.png;Lime Bundle.png;Green Bundle.png;Cyan Bundle.png;Light Blue Bundle.png;Blue Bundle.png;Purple Bundle.png;Magenta Bundle.png;Pink Bundle.png|84px}} <br> {{animate|Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;White Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Light Gray Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Gray Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Black Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Brown Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Red Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Orange Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Yellow Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Lime Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Green Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Cyan Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Light Blue Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Blue Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Purple Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Magenta Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png;Pink Bundle Open JE1 BE1.png|84px}}
| Can now be found in some [[village]] chests.
|-
| [[Egg]]
| {{animate|Blue Egg.png;Brown Egg.png|84px}}
| 
* New variants of the [[egg]] has been added.
** Blue egg: A variant of the [[egg]] laid by the cold chicken variant.
** Brown egg: A variant of the [[egg]] laid by the warm chicken variant.
* Spawns the corresponding chicken variant when hatched.
|-
| [[Resin clump]]
| [[File:Resin Clump JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
| The [[XP]] rewarded for [[smelting]] resin clumps into [[resin bricks]] has been reduced from 0.3 to 0.1.
|-
| [[Spawn egg]]
| [[File:Creeper_Spawn_Egg_JE3_BE2.png|84px]]
| Changed the visuals of all spawn eggs to make them easier to distinguish: each type of spawn egg now has its own unique icon instead of all just being colored variants of the same spotted egg.
|}

== Biomes ==

=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Biomes}}
|-
| [[Pale garden]]
| [[File:Pale_Garden.png|256px]]
| 
* Pale garden biome now occupies more space that was previously taken by [[dark forest]]s.
* [[Woodland mansion]]s can now generate in pale garden biome.
|-
| [[Dark forest]]
| [[File:Dark_Forest.png|256px]]
| Updated the tree composition in dark forests to match {{JE}}, increasing the number of dark oak trees and reducing the prevalence of other tree types.
|}

== Gameplay ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Gameplay}}
|-
| [[Pause menu]]
| Added ability to pause the game in singleplayer worlds when entering the pause screen, the feature can be turned on/off from the [[settings]] in the general section.
|}
